Event.name: Undergo_change
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an <fen>Attribute</fen>. In the first case, where category membership is changing, an <fen>Initial_category</fen> and a <fen>Final_category</fen> may be expressed. In the second case, where a situation as a whole is changing, an <fen>Initial_situation</fen> and a <fen>Final_situation</fen> can be present. And in the last case, where some characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen> is changing, an <fen>Initial_quality</fen> and a <fen>Final_quality</fen> can be specified.
<ex>As soon as Tiffany kissed the frog, <fex name="ent">Tiffany</fex> <t>turned</t> <fex name="finc">into a frog</fex>. </ex>
<ex>He chanted and <fex name="ent">the rock</fex> <t>changed</t> <fex name="att">shape</fex>, becoming a great double bitted axe.</ex>
<ex>The College has <t>changed</t> <fex name="deg">markedly</fex> over the century since it first opened its doors.</ex>
<ex>If I'm understanding you correctly, you want the switchbar color to <t>change</t> <fex name="Circumstances">whenever the bot says something</fex>?</ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">My life</fex> instantly <t>changed</t> <fex name="inic">from an empty life</fex>, <fex name="finc">to a life full of joy and purpose</fex>.</ex>
<ex>As you can see, <fex name="ent">the word WALK</fex> <t>changed</t> <fex name="iniq">from red</fex> <fex name="finq">to green</fex> rather than have a separate lens for each colour.</ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">My feet</fex> <t>turned</t> <fex name="finc">to stone</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">The promise</fex> will <t>turn</t> <fex name="finc">to ashes</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">if progress is not made</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="att">The price</fex> <t>changed</t> <fex name="iniq">from $1.26</fex> <fex name="finq">to $1.27 per pint</fex>. <fex name="ent">DNI</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">At least one relative instruction</fex> has <t>changed</t> <fex name="att">in size</fex> <fex name="iniq">from short</fex> <fex name="finq">to long</fex>.</ex>
In some cases, the types of perspective are mixed, so that, e.g., an <fen>Initial_quality</fen> is mixed with a <fen>Final_situation</fen>; this is usually considered poor style.
<ex><fex name="Entity">She</fex> <t>went</t> <fex name="Initial_quality">from confused</fex> <fex name="Final_situation">to acting completely confident</fex> .</ex>
This frame is often the target domain of motion metaphors, in which the moving Theme corresponds to the changing <fen>Entity</fen>, the Source of motion corresponds to the <fen>Initial_category</fen>, <fen>Initial_quality</fen>, or <fen>Initial_situation</fen> and the Goal of motion corresponds to the <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_quality</fen>, or <fen>Final_situation</fen> of the <fen>Entity</fen>. By correspondence with the complex domain of motion, this metaphor introduces several FEs to the target domain of change, such as an Intermediate_state (etc.) from Path, and Tendency_of_change from Direction.
<ex>The nation was crawling towards oblivion.</ex> <ex>We were walking past almost reasonable and heading right for what-the-bleep.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change.
<ex>How pleasing to see that <fex name="ent">Martha</fex> has <t>changed</t> now.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_category
Arg.definition: <def-root>The type of <fen>Entity</fen> that results from the change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_category
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to before it undergoes the change.
<ex>The viccar <t>changed</t> <fex name="inic">from a professional clergyman</fex> into an anti-ecclesiastical activist.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> undergoes the transformation. <ex><fex name="tim">Then</fex> she <t>turned</t> into a lizard.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_quality
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The value of the <fen>Attribute</fen> before the change takes place.
<ex>At that time, my asthma <t>changed</t> <fex name="iniq">from very mild</fex> to severe.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Final_quality
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The quality of the <fen>Attribute</fen> that results from the change.
<ex>Its color <t>changed</t> from red <fex name="finq">to blue</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Attribute
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a quality can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement, or observation.
<ex>Test to check if <fex name="att">the color</fex> <t>changes</t> when you place your mouse over the JavaScript image</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the Change event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way).
<ex>He also identified all of the places where cancer rates or pollution levels <t>changed</t> <fex name="man">quickly</fex> over short periods of time.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the initial and final categories, situations, or qualities differ from each other.
<ex>Industrial economics has <t>changed</t> <fex name="deg">a lot</fex> during the last two decades</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The physical or abstract <fen>Circumstances</fen> under which the change takes place.
<ex>Information may <t>change</t> <fex name="Circumstances">whenever the US Department of Education issues additional guidance or regulations</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event or state that causes the change to take place.
<ex>Doctors' practices have <t>changed</t> <fex name="cau">due to concerns over medical litigation</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Intermediate_value
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes before the <fen>Final_value</fen> obtains.
<ex>The slurry was stirred until the color of the suspension <t>changed</t> from red <fex name="intv">via orange</fex> to yellow over a period of two hours.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Value_range
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Initial_value</fen> and <fen>Final_value</fen> taken together as the range through which the <fen>Entity</fen> changes.
The main faith of the church has <t>changed</t> <fex name="val">between Orthodox, Protestant and Greek Catholic</fex> several times.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location that the change takes place.</def-root>

Arg.name: Final_situation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation that results from the change.
<ex>Tests <t>went</t> from taking three hours <fex name="Final_situation">to needing less than one</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_situation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The situation that the <fen>Entity</fen> began in.
<ex>She slowly <t>shifted</t> <fex name="Initial_situation">from giving him makework</fex> to actually finding he had some skills .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: turn.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change in nature, state, form, or colour

lexUnit.name: veer.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rapidly change course of action

lexUnit.name: swing.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to suddenly change a course of action or emotion

lexUnit.name: plummet.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change rapidly for the worse

lexUnit.name: shift.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to undergo change relatively rapidly, often between multiple states.

lexUnit.name: transition.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the process of changing from one state or condition to another.

lexUnit.name: go.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: change from one state to another.
